sentences.english: His body was found in the Floor hole.
sentences.chinese: 他的躯体发现在楼栋里。

sentences.english: The body is brawny, limbs forceful, head round eyes, short neck little kiss long.
sentences.chinese: 躯体粗壮，四肢强健有力，头圆颈短，眼小吻长。

sentences.english: If flexibility isn’t your strong suit, simply bend your knees to adjust.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的躯体不够灵活，可以弯曲膝部来调整一下。

sentences.english: A ladybug can retract its head into its body.
sentences.chinese: 瓢虫可以将自己的头缩回到躯体中去。

sentences.english: And because of his sinful life, Jada attained the body of a ghost.
sentences.chinese: 由于他罪恶的一生，加达得到了一个鬼魂的躯体。

sentences.english: To include all the geographical names will swell the bulk of this book too much.
sentences.chinese: 包含所有地理名会使这本书躯体胀起太多。

sentences.english: Objective To explore change of sleep electroencephalography in depressions with physical anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨躯体焦虑性抑郁症病人的睡眠脑电图改变。

sentences.english: Except somatization, the other factors were more notable.
sentences.chinese: 除躯体化外，其它因子更为突出。

sentences.english: This means they act as if they creating rather thane mending the body.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着它们将再生而非修复其躯体。

sentences.english: He gets rid of all my physical problems and he loosens my body.
sentences.chinese: 他帮我克服了之前的身体问题，放松了我的躯体。

sentences.english: Most ladybugs have oval, domeshaped bodies with six short legs.
sentences.chinese: 多数瓢虫有椭圆形盖装的躯体和六只腿。

sentences.english: All human beings are individual cells in the larger body of humanity.
sentences.chinese: 所有的世人，都是人类这个上层躯体里的个体细胞。

sentences.english: These fields of energy are called "bodies" or "vehicles" in the theosophical literature.
sentences.chinese: 这些能量场在神智学作品中称作“躯体”或“载体”。

sentences.english: not just here--everywhere in O'Connor's fiction?
sentences.chinese: 那些躯体一直在被分割成碎片？

sentences.english: He showed that physical sicknesses and disabilities sometimes were caused by emotional conflicts.
sentences.chinese: 他证明，躯体性疾病或伤残有时是由情感冲突引起的。

sentences.english: You are Pure and Bodiless. You have no mind.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友，你是纯净而无躯体的，你也没有内心。

definition: main part/torso/the thing in itself/noumenon (object of purely intellectual perception according to Kant)
human shape/in human form/of human appearance/doll/puppet
the four limbs of the body
the body/organism (usually human)/(fig.) fabric (of society etc)/cohesive structure (of an entity)
